Trial_Design.evidence: A case control study design was used to investigate group differences before and after a standardized intervention.

Participants.evidence: ICU‐treated COVID‐19 patients without underlying kidney disease were assigned to two groups based on KDIGO Creatinine criteria for AKI.

Intervention.evidence: Renal perfusion was assessed by magnetic resonance imaging using phase contrast and arterial spin labeling before and directly after plasma expansion with 7.5 mL/kg Ringer's Acetate (Baxter).

Objective.evidence: The objective of this study was to compare the effects of plasma expansion with a standardized fluid bolus on renal perfusion in critically ill patients with AKI compared to similar patients without AKI.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Renal perfusion was assessed by magnetic resonance imaging using phase contrast and arterial spin labeling before and directly after plasma expansion.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Nine patients with AKI and eight without were included in the study.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The hemodynamic response to plasma expansion was similar in both groups, with increases in MAP by 9 mmHg (95% CI 0.5–18) and 15 mmHg (95% CI 5–24) in patients with and without AKI, respectively.
